content: What chemical element has the symbol Ag and atomic number 47?

Silver (Ag) is a chemical element with the atomic number 47. It is a transition metal known for its electrical conductivity, malleability, and resistance to corrosion. Silver is commonly used in jewelry, coins, tableware, and electrical contacts due to its lustrous appearance and excellent conductivity. It also has applications in photography, mirrors, and as a catalyst in various chemical reactions.
